A tip for using the block editor: A tip for using the block editor
Use the Tab key and Arrow keys to choose: Use the Tab key and Arrow keys to choose new block location. Use Left and Right Arrow keys to move between nesting levels. Once location is selected, press Enter or Space to move the block.
You are currently in navigation mode. Na: You are currently in navigation mode. Navigate blocks using the Tab key and Arrow keys. Use Left and Right Arrow keys to move between nesting levels. To exit navigation mode and edit the selected block, press Enter.
Indent a list by pressing <kbd>space<\/k: Indent a list by pressing <kbd>space</kbd> at the beginning of a line.
Drag files into the editor to automatica: Drag files into the editor to automatically insert media blocks.
Change a block's type by pressing the bl: Change a block's type by pressing the block icon on the toolbar.
Outdent a list by pressing <kbd>backspac: Outdent a list by pressing <kbd>backspace</kbd> at the beginning of a line.

Tools offer different interactions for b: Tools offer different interactions for block selection & editing. To select, press Escape, to go back to editing, press Enter.
Toggle between using the same value for: Toggle between using the same value for all screen sizes or using a unique value per screen size.

Enter a word or two \u2014 without space: Enter a word or two — without spaces — to make a unique web address just for this block, called an “anchor.” Then, you’ll be able to link directly to this section of your page.
